meanings.definition: The act of casting someone in an unsuitable role.
meanings.sent1: The miscasting of the young actor as the wise old king confused the audience.
meanings.sent2: The director's miscasting of the comedian in a serious drama raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent3: The miscasting of the tiny kitten as a fierce lion in the school play was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her miscasting as a villain in real life was a stark contrast to her kind nature.
meanings.sent5: The miscasting of the shy student as the class clown made for an unforgettable performance.

meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly assigning someone to a role in a play or movie.
meanings.sent1: The miscasting of the lead actress as a supporting character was a big mistake.
meanings.sent2: The producer's miscasting of the action star in a romantic comedy did not sit well with critics.
meanings.sent3: The miscasting of the dog as the lead actor in the play added a hilarious twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her miscasting as a hero in the movie was like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The miscasting of the scientist as a cowboy in the film made for an interesting juxtaposition.
